page.title: 04LOCAL SHOPPING.
page.content: WITHIN THE STUDY AREA THERE WERE THREE AREAS WHICH HAD LOCAL SHOPPING FACILITIES. IN ALL CASES THE SHOPS WERE CONVENIENCE GOODS SHOPS SERVING A VERY SMALL MARKET AREA. SHOPPERS USED THE CENTRES FOR SMALL ITEMS AND DID NOT TEND TO A LARGE AMOUNT OF SHOPPING IN THE CENTRES. HOWEVER, THESE CENTRES WERE USED VERY REGULARLY BY THE PEOPLE WITHIN THE SURVEY. IT IS DUE TO THE HIGH FREQUENCY OF USE BY THE SHOPPERS THAT THE MARKET AREA CAN BE SO SMALL WHILE STILL ENABLING THE SHOPS TO MAKE A SATISFACTORY TURNOVER. THE SHAPE OF THE MARKET AREA IS STRONGLY INFLUENCED BY THE LOCATION OF OTHER SHOPPING CENTRES, USUALLY OFFERING A WIDER SELECTION OF SERVICES. IN ALL CASES THESE LOCAL SHOPPING CENTRES WERE LOCATED AT A ROAD JUNCTION IN AN EFFORT TO INCREASE ACCESSIBILITY.
